intro: Telfairia batesii, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has oval-shaped, edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Its leaves are also consumed as a vegetable in some regions. However, caution is advised as certain parts of the plant may contain toxic compounds.
